data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Textile and Garmenting Policy 2022 - Financial Incentives for starting new employment to the youth of the state(Male/Female) - Production sector - Weaving (Handloom/Power Looms) - New
data.benefits: The maximum limit of this subsidy will be Rs. 20 Lakh per person (or group) for Handloom sector and Rs. 60 lakh per person (or group) for the power loom sector.
data.eligibility: Students who have passed three years diploma from Indian Institute of Handloom Technology (I.I.H.T) and have started new employment related to the weaving.
data.conditions: Started new employment related to the weaving by installing either 5 to 20 number of Handlooms or 5 to 10 number of Power looms in a shed will be incentivised by providing subsidy of 75 percent of the project cost.
data.beneficiaries: All Manufacturing and service industries engaged Pharmaceutical and Medical Devices sector are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites: Started new employment related to the weaving by installing either 5 to 20 number of Handlooms or 5 to 10 number of Power looms in a shed will be incentivised by providing subsidy of 75 percent of the project cost.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Textile, Department of Textile
data.context: The Uttar Pradesh Textile and Garmenting Policy 2022 aims to boost the textile and garment industry in the state. It was introduced to attract investments, create jobs, and position Uttar Pradesh as a leading hub for textile and apparel manufacturing.
data.objective: The youth (resident male/female of Uttar Pradesh) shall be encouraged towards Self-employment related to the production, design, marketing and export of handloom and textile products. This special facility will be available to youth (males/females) who are not above 35 years of age.
data.description:
Students who have passed three years diploma from Indian Institute of Handloom Technology (I.I.H.T) and have started new employment related to the weaving by
installing either 5 to 20 number of Handlooms or 5 to 10 number of Power looms in a shed, will be incentivised by providing subsidy of 75 percent of the project cost.
The maximum limit of this subsidy will be Rs. 20 Lakh per person (or group) for Handloom sector and Rs. 60 lakh per person (or group) for the power loom sector.
data.how_to_apply: Scheme can be applied through Nivesh Mitra Portal of Uttar Pradesh Government
data.funding_facilitator: Directorate of Textile, Department of Textile
data.funding_mechanism: The beneficiary will get the benefit after the approval of application by the funding facilitator.
data.highlights: The Department of Handloom and Textiles, Government of Uttar Pradesh shall appoint a team of professionals as Project Management Agency (PMA) for policy implementation and supporting the department in publicizing the policy benefits among national / international investors, brands and other stakeholders and providing prompt support to the investors.
data.additional_info: Preference will be given to those resident/s, in purchase of land from UPSIDA, GIDA, NOIDA, GREATER NOIDA or other authorities, to start new employment.
data.checklist_info_a:
1.Copy of Udyam Registration Certificate (URC)
2. Certificate of Incorporation/ Partnership deed/Partnership registration/ Co- operative society 
registration. 
3.KYC Details
data.checklist_info_d: Picup Bhawan, Block A, 4th Floor, Lucknow, UP, 0522-3117976, info@investup.org.in
data.beneficiary: Manufacturing All Textile and Garmenting Units - All Entities - Uttarpradesh - All MSMES & All Non MSMEs
